meanings.definition: The amount of content that fills a page.
meanings.sent1: I wrote pagefuls of notes during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The book was so interesting that I read pagefuls in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: She had to carry pagefuls of books to the library for research.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a library with pagefuls of memories stored on each shelf.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's feedback was a pageful of constructive criticism.

meanings.definition: A large quantity of written material that fills multiple pages.
meanings.sent1: The novel was so captivating that I read pagefuls every night.
meanings.sent2: The report was filled with pagefuls of data and analysis.
meanings.sent3: He had to print pagefuls of documents for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like pagefuls of joy.
meanings.sent5: The old library was a treasure trove with pagefuls of ancient manuscripts.
